title: Am I eating calories when I am chewing a gum? - Quora

response.answer_text: yes, even the sugarless gum has calories due to the sugar alcohol used for the sweet flavor. sugarless gum always says not a calorie free food, and averages about 5 calories per piece. sugar gum is not that much more, but remember sugar creates acid on the teeth.

Yes, but a piece of chewing gum is usually so small that the amount of calories in it rarely exceeds about 5 calories. It is not a significant amount that’s worth worrying about. Everything else you eat has more calories.
No. You're perhaps burning them. An average gum has 5–10 calories and if you're chewing it for about 10–15 minutes you're likely to burn a little over that.
If the chewing gum is made with sugar, it will have calories from the sugar. If the chewing gum is made with a sugar-free sweetener then it won’t have calories unless the flavoring has calories.
